page.title: 08 INDUSTRY
page.content: The manufacturing industry in the block is mostly concentrated in one area. The largest firm employs about 200 people and the smallest 4, but most have between 20 and 90 employees. Mouldings and castings in plastic and metal are made for things like gears, sprockets, shields, switches and cabinets. Working on electrical and electronic parts is also popular. One firm makes all kinds of special tubing while another presses, assembles and plates mounts for jewellery. There is a mixture of older buildings and small units in a modern complex. One small printing works is right on the edge of the farming area in a converted chapel which is over 100 years old. It looks deceptively small from outside but has several machines inside. It is a family business, and one man has worked there for over 30 years.
